Name: Validation - PE
Text: To confirm the root causes, I cross-checked timelines of events for delayed cases. Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: I hypothesized that delays in escalation processing (e.g., Case 105) and investigation start times (e.g., Case 104) could result from overloaded agents, inefficient handoffs, or prioritization issues.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: I linked delays to possible systemic issues: resource constraints, process inefficiencies, and manual prioritization errors. For example, escalations in Case 102 and 105 faced bottlenecks likely due to Level-2 understaffing or lack of automated routing.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: I proposed that cases like 104, with no escalation, experienced delays due to overloaded Level-1 agents or inefficient ticket queues. Similarly, escalations in Cases 102 and 105 might require process automation and streamlined routing to reduce delays.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: To support my recommendations, I mapped SLA-based solutions, automated routing, and Level-2 resource adjustments to address delays. I validated that automating escalations could eliminate long gaps like the 36-hour delay in Case 105.
